result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated May 31, 2022 - Letter from defendant to request charge in Spanish.  Clerk will forward another letter to defendant and a copy of letter to Atty. with 2nd request. ss

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated May 23, 2022 from Defendant Paul Vicuna-Amaya asking for a copy of his complaint in Spanish. Clerk sent defendant a letter to inform him that an email was forwarded to his attorney along with his request on 5-26-22.** ss
Hearing on June 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

08:22 AM Defendant Paul A Vicuna Amaya in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Interpreter sworn in.  City of New Berlin Police Department Detective Thomas Johannik sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Thompson.  Cross examination by Attorney Fischer.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Fischer objects to bind over with argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Hearing on March 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Tri-City National Bank/Wintrust Bank listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use/possess any device capable of accessing the internet such as a smartphone, laptop, tablet, and desktop computer.  Defendant is not to perform any electronic financial transaction that is not for himself.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 48 hours of release from custody.

01:56 PM Defendant Paul A Vicuna Amaya in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared by Zoom as interpreter.  Attorney Jensen appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.
